Sentence.Original: [0]I went to the guesthouse and got charcoal for[1]the barbecue, but on the way back[2]I ran into Dad, who'd got an urgent phone call[3]and had to get back to the lab.[4]Now I'm waiting for Gina, the person Dad sent[5]to keep me company while I wait for him.[6]
Sentence.Translation: [0]我去了趟商店，为烧烤准备了[1]一点儿木炭，在回来的路上[2]碰见了爸爸，他刚接到一个紧急电话[3]正要赶回研究所。[4]现在我正在等吉娜，爸爸不放心我一个人，[5]就让吉娜来陪我。[6]

Sentence.Original: [0]Hello.[1]Huh?[2]Are you Ashley?[3]Yeah.[4]Who are you?[5]I came here instead of Gina.[6]I'm here to have the barbecue with you.[7]Instead of Gina?[8]Why didn't she come?[9]Gina said that Dr Robins had asked her to[10]keep you company.[11]But unfortunately, she had some urgent work[12]to attend to and was unable to come.[13]Urgent work? What happened?[14]I'm sorry, I don't know exactly what it was. In[15]any case, she wasn't able to come here.[16]And so I came in her place.[17]I believe Gina has already informed Dr Robins[18]that I came here instead.[19]But...[20]You seem unsettled.[21]Do I really seem so bad?[22]No, that's not it. It's just...[23]It's just?[24]I was just wondering, isn't having a barbecue[25]with someone you just met kind of...[26]Strange?[27]Yeah...[28]I suppose I feel the same way.[29]Really?[30]Yes. But even with something as unplanned[31]as this, two strangers can talk and share[32]their views on life.[33]Perhaps that could make it enjoyable.[34]Forgive me, I haven't introduced myself.[35]My name is [36]Ryan Gray[37]. I am a scientist at JC[38]Valley, like your father.[39]Nice to meet you.[40]Wait![41]
Sentence.Translation: [0]你好。[1]嗯？[2]你就是阿修蕾？[3]对啊。[4]你是？[5]我是代替吉娜来[6]陪你一起烧烤的。[7]代替吉娜？[8]她怎么没来？[9]吉娜告诉我说，是罗宾斯博士[10]请她来陪你的。[11]但真不巧……她有急事要处理，[12]所以不能亲自来了。[13]急事？要紧吗？[14]实在不好意思，我也不清楚是怎么回事，[15]总之……现在她没法脱身，[16]所以你看，我来陪你了。[17]不过吉娜应该已经把我代替她过来这事[18]通知给罗宾斯博士了吧。[19]但是……[20]你看上去很不安呐，[21]我就那么像坏人？[22]不！不是这个意思，只是……[23]只是？[24]我只是不习惯，总觉得跟一个才见面的人一起烧烤，[25]会有点……[26]奇怪？[27]是啊……[28]其实我也挺紧张的。[29]真的吗？[30]是啊。但是我觉得既然两个陌生人[31]能够在这种情况下邂逅，[32]那倒不妨一起畅谈人生吧，[33]这样才能消除隔阂。[34]噢！原谅我还没先做自我介绍。[35]我的名字叫[36]莱恩·格雷[37]我是JC山谷的研究员，[38]跟你爸爸一样哦。[39]很高兴见到你。[40]等等！[41]

Sentence.Original: [0]I've seen this man before...[1]Somewhere...[2]
Sentence.Translation: [0]我以前见过这个男人……[1]在什么地方呢……[2]

Sentence.Original: [0]Ryan Gray.[1]Where have I met you before?[2]
Sentence.Translation: [0]莱恩·格雷。[1]我以前在哪里见过你？[2]

Sentence.Original: [0]Ashley?[1]Huh?[2]

[0]Are you unwell? You looked like you were about[1]to pass out.[2]Ryan...[3]Yes?[4]Have we...[5]Have we...?[6]Have we met before?[7]Not that I recall.[8]This is the first time that we have met, to the[9]best of my knowledge.[10]However...[11]It is not uncommon to meet someone and think[12]that you've seen them somewhere before.[13]
Sentence.Translation: [0]觉得不舒服吗？[1]你看上去好像有点犯晕。[2]莱恩……[3]怎么了？[4]我们……[5]我们什么？[6]我们以前见过面吧？[7]没有吧。[8]如果我没得失忆症的话，[9]这应该是我们第一次见面。[10]但是……[11]初次见面而又觉得似曾相识，[12]这种事，常有的不是吗。[13]

Sentence.Original: [0]No... I'm still sure I've seen you before[1]somewhere.[2]Oh?[3]I remembered it when I saw you.[4]I've definitely seen you somewhere before.[5]You recognise me from somewhere?[6]Yeah...[7]I was here with my mom 13 years ago.[8]Maybe I met you back then.[9]I see... Hmm...[10]Ashley, how old are you?[11]I'm 16.[12]Which means that 13 years ago, you were three.[13]There is a theory regarding myelination in the [14]human hippocampus, stating that as this[15]particular development is a slow process, the[16]hippocampus is not fully formed until the age[17]of three or four years old. If we consider the[18]concept of implicit memory, where emotions,[19]memory of basic tasks and facial recognition[20]develop before the age of three, it is not[21]an impossibility for you to retain memories[22]from 13 years ago. However, the majority of[23]test subjects cannot recall episodes or events[24]from their own childhood, which would imply[25]that explicit memory has not developed by that[26]stage.[27]Sorry, I didn't understand a word of that.[28]What are you telling me?[29]What I mean is that...[30]Your recognition of my face may be due to[31]ambiguous, unreliable memories.[32]Ambiguous, unreliable memories?[33]But as soon as I arrived here, I suddenly[34]started remembering my mom...[35]Ashley, do you think that coming here may be a[36]trigger that made you remember your mother?[37]Yeah...[38]Let me ask you something.[39]Okay.[40]Did you come here today by your own free will?[41]By which I mean, did you yourself decide to [42]come here?[43]No.[44]My dad called me here.[45]So Dr Robins invited you here, correct?[46]Yeah.[47]My dad knew that I'd been here with my mom[48]13 years ago...[49]So he wanted to show me the place again.[50]I see.[51]Before I came here...[52]I had no idea that I'd even been here, let alone[53]with my mom.[54]But when I came here and saw everything...[55]I suddenly started remembering my mom[56]and the last time I was here.[57]And you also remembered something when you[58]saw me, correct?[59]Yeah...[60]But if you ask me whether I'm completely sure[61]that all of the memories are true...[62]I couldn't honestly say I was sure.[63]I see...[64]Ashley, we call sudden memories like that[65]"flashbacks".[66]It usually happens when you have a traumatic[67]experience or mental scarring.[68]Did anything like that happen to you 13 years[69]ago?[70]Yeah...[71]On the night of my third birthday, my mom[72]died.[73]She was killed...13 years ago.[74]A great pity.[75]Sayoko Robins was killed 13 years ago, at the[76]young age of 28.[77]Wait...[78]You know about my mom?[79]Of course.[80]The death of Sayoko Robins was a great loss[81]for the entire scientific community, especially[82]for those of us focused on memory research.[83]And now, after 13 years, I have the chance[84]to meet her daughter.[85]It is quite an unexpected opportunity.[86]
Sentence.Translation: [0]不……我还是觉得以前在哪里……[1]有见过你。[2]噢？[3]一见到你我就觉得眼熟，[4]肯定以前在哪里见过你。[5]你在某个地方见过我？[6]是的……[7]十三年前我跟我妈妈来过这里，[8]或许是那个时候。[9]嗯……我想想……[10]阿修蕾，你今年几岁啊？[11]十六岁。[12]也就是说十三年前，你只有三岁。[13]有一种关于人类海马体中髓鞘形成[14]的理论，说是由于这一组织结构的生长[15]相对来说是一个缓慢的过程，所以[16]在人类三岁到四岁之前，负责记忆的海马体并没有真正成形。[17]所以你不会记得我。[18]但如果考虑到你的内隐记忆，那么[19]三岁前的情感发育、基本活动能力以及人脸识别功能等等[20]这些十三年前的回忆，[21]倒也是可能有所保留呢。[22]然而，实验对象中的[23]绝大多数人都无法回忆起童年的一些[24]事件以及片段，这又说明了[25]内隐记忆并没有[26]在这个年龄阶段出现。[27]呃……我觉得我一个字都没听懂。[28]你想告诉我什么？[29]我的意思是说……[30]你觉得我眼熟很可能是由于一些[31]模棱两可且不怎么可靠的记忆。[32]模棱两可？不可靠？[33]但是我一到了这儿，就会突然[34]想起妈妈呀……[35]阿修蕾，你是不是想说来到这里触景生情，[36]想到了你的妈妈？[37]是的……[38]那我问你些事情。[39]好的。[40]你现在站在这里，是由于你的意思自治吗？[41]好吧……说简单点，是你自己决定[42]来这里的吗？[43]不是的。[44]爸爸叫我来的。[45]也就是说，罗宾斯博士叫你来的,对吗？[46]没错。[47]爸爸知道十三年前，[48]我和妈妈一起来过这里，[49]所以他想让我再次回到这里。[50]我懂了。[51]在我来之前……[52]我根本没意识到曾经来过这里，更不用说……[53]还是和妈妈一起来的。[54]但当我到了这里，看到了这里的一切……[55]就突然在脑海中闪现出妈妈的影子，[56]以及我曾经来过这里的事实。[57]你还想起了曾经看到过我的一些事，[58]对吗？[59]是的……[60]但正如你要问我是不是百分百肯定[61]这些记忆的真实性……[62]我就真的不那么自信了。[63]我明白了。[64]阿修蕾，我们通常把这种突然出现的记忆称为[65]“闪影”。[66]这通常是由于精神创伤、[67]心理或者经历上的恐惧导致的。[68]十三年前，有没有这类事情[69]发生过？[70]是的……[71]在我三岁生日的晚上，妈妈……[72]死了。[73]她是被杀害的……就在十三年前……[74]啊……遗憾……[75]只有28岁啊……沙夜子·罗宾斯，[76]十三年前被杀害了。[77]等等……[78]你知道我妈妈？[79]当然。[80]沙夜子·罗宾斯的死，对于整个科研界来说[81]都是一个很大的损失，尤其是[82]对于像我们这样专注于研究记忆的。[83]如今，十三年过去了……我在这里[84]见到了她的女儿。[85]真是机缘巧合。[86]

Sentence.Original: [0]That was really great![1]I dunno why, but eating outside makes it taste[2]so much nicer.[3]Indeed.[4]It was quite delicious.[5]Do you like barbecues?[6]Yeah, I like them, but today's barbecue[7]was totally amazing.[8]I can't stand peppers, and I even ate them![9]You don't like peppers?[10]Nope.[11]I can kind of eat them now, but when I was[12]little I couldn't stand them at all.[13]I'm the same.[14]Really?[15]It is said the best way to overcome hatred of a[16]food is by force of will and careful cooking.[17]Perhaps today's barbecue helped you grow to[18]enjoy peppers.[19]You think?[20]I do indeed.[21]
Sentence.Translation: [0]真的很美味啊！[1]不知道是什么原因，但在室外吃东西，[2]显得更美味呢。[3]确实如此。[4]这些东西非常好吃。[5]你平时喜欢烧烤吗？[6]是的，我喜欢，尤其是今天的烧烤，[7]简直太合我胃口啦！[8]我最受不了胡椒了，但今天我也吃了！[9]你不喜欢胡椒吗？[10]也不是。[11]我现在是能吃一点，[12]但小时候完全不能接受。[13]我也一样。[14]真的吗？[15]据说克服厌食的最好方法，[16]就是意志之力和美妙的烹饪。[17]或许今天的烧烤可以帮助你增加对[18]胡椒的喜爱。[19]你是认真的？[20]我是认真的。[21]

Sentence.Original: [0]Ashley, let's talk about Sayoko.[1]You wanted to ask me about her, didn't you?[2]Yeah.[3]How do you know her?[4]Before I was recruited by JC Valley, I was[5]occasionally at MJ Labs.[6]MJ Labs was where Mom worked, right?[7]Yes, Dr Robins and Sayoko were both[8]researching Another there.[9]So you know about Another?[10]Yes, I do.[11]And I knew Sayoko when she was working on[12]Another...[13]Ah...[14]So there are people at JC Valley who know[15]about Another...[16]There are.[17]

Sentence.Original: [0]What did you mean when you said that Mom[1]was someone you'd never forget?[2]I meant that I remember her very well.[3]Why?[4]When I started out in research, Sayoko was[5]the first scientist I ever met.[6]She taught me the very fundamentals of[7]being a scientist.[8]What kind of person was she?[9]She was a truly incredible scientist.[10]To this day, I have yet to meet someone that[11]could even hope to surpass her.[12]She was that good?[13]Oh, absolutely.[14]If she were still alive today...[15]I can only imagine what incredible things might[16]have developed from her research.[17]

Sentence.Original: [0]Dr Robins?[1]So you know my dad?[2]Yeah, I guess I do.[3]I knew he had a little girl, but I didn't think that[4]it would be you.[5]How do you know him?[6]Well, it must have been two months ago now...[7]I helped your pops put the bait on his fishing[8]line up at the lake.[9]Since then, we meet and chat sometimes while[10]I'm out on patrol.[11]My dad fishes?[12]He sure does. Seems he started fairly recently,[13]though.[14]But he still hasn't caught anything big. They[15]just keep eating his bait.[16]Sounds about right.[17]Then again, not many people have caught[18]in the lake recently.[19]Anyway...[20]Your pops is a real funny guy.[21]Funny? My dad?[22]Yeah. As soon as he runs into something he's not[23]familiar with, it's like looking at a little kid.[24]The rest of the world might be long gone for all[25]he knows.
